questions.questionText: In Joshua 1, which four movements outline the book's structure?
questions.explanation: Joshua's opening chapter previews four sections: Cross (1:1–5:12), Take (5:13–12:24), Divide (13:1–21:45), and Service (22:1–24:33).

questions.questionText: What is the primary ground of Israel's success in Joshua 1?
questions.explanation: The presence of the Lord is decisive.

questions.questionText: in Joshua 1:3 is best understood as:
questions.explanation: When God speaks, the perfect form signals an assured outcome—the 'prophetic perfect.'

questions.questionText: Why is Joshua told twice to be strong and courageous?
options: To remain faithful to Torah in daunting circumstances
questions.correctAnswer: To remain faithful to Torah in daunting circumstances
questions.explanation: Strength and courage are tied to faithful obedience to the Torah amid overwhelming odds.

questions.questionText: In biblical perspective (Josh 1; Ps 1), 'success' (tsalakh/sakal) primarily means:
options: Harmony with God's wisdom and obedience to His Word
questions.correctAnswer: Harmony with God's wisdom and obedience to His Word
questions.explanation: Success is acting wisely under God's law, not merely material gain.

questions.questionText: Which day of the week is the biblical Sabbath?
questions.explanation: The seventh day (Saturday) is the biblical Sabbath, as established in Genesis 2:2-3 and confirmed in the Fourth Commandment.

questions.questionText: The Sabbath was made holy at:
questions.explanation: Genesis 2:3 shows that God blessed and sanctified the seventh day at creation, before sin entered the world.

questions.questionText: Jesus said the Sabbath was made for:
questions.explanation: In Mark 2:27, Jesus said 'The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath,' indicating it's for all humanity.

questions.questionText: The Fourth Commandment begins with which word?
questions.explanation: Exodus 20:8 begins 'Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy,' emphasizing that the Sabbath already existed.

questions.questionText: In 1844, Christ entered which apartment of the heavenly sanctuary?
questions.explanation: According to Daniel 8:14 and Adventist understanding, Christ entered the Most Holy Place in 1844 to begin the investigative judgment.

questions.questionText: The investigative judgment examines the records of:
options: All who have professed faith in God
questions.correctAnswer: All who have professed faith in God
questions.explanation: The investigative judgment reviews the cases of all who have claimed to follow God, determining who will receive eternal life.

questions.questionText: The earthly sanctuary was a copy of:
questions.explanation: Hebrews 8:5 states that the earthly sanctuary was 'a copy and shadow of heavenly things.'

questions.questionText: What does the incense in the sanctuary represent?
questions.explanation: Revelation 8:3-4 shows that incense represents 'the prayers of all saints' offered before God's throne.
